item.title: New halo sig
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

ok. Ill try and read some tutorials
to Edit* pslover!!!

item.title: New halo sig
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

[quote=“fellixombc, post:8, topic:70558”][quote author=kaza link=topic=103645.msg1045799#msg1045799 date=1174777516]
It looks okay, although the render isn’t the thing i first look at in the sig, and it should be :P.

Try a different render, not master chief for once, needs to be different !

And try to stick with brushes that work together, vector and grunge…they don’t work very well. Grunge and abstract? If used in the right way, yes.

Anyway, 6/10, halo too overused.

[/quote]
I see wat you mean, i’ll go get some abstract brushes[/quote]

For once, why not try to make a sig with doing as little brushing as possible, brushing for effects, not for the whole background, read some tutorials!

Read full topic

item.title: New halo sig
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

7.5/10

Again the white thing or MC too look at

Too much negative space

Brushes look pretty good but add a few more in there, add a couple filters and dupe and play around with it a bit

item.title: New halo sig
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

It looks okay, although the render isn’t the thing i first look at in the sig, and it should be :P.

Try a different render, not master chief for once, needs to be different !

And try to stick with brushes that work together, vector and grunge…they don’t work very well. Grunge and abstract? If used in the right way, yes.

Anyway, 6/10, halo too overused.
